intro: Salicornia doeringii, commonly known as sea beans, is a halophyte plant adapted to grow in saline environments. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and estuaries where it thrives in high-salinity conditions. Its leaves are reduced to small scales, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Salicornia doeringii plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
